It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to coastal regions of southern Europe and is adapted to sandy or rocky shores. Its rigid, upright stems and serrated leaves help it withstand harsh maritime conditions. Cephalomanes rigidum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in coastal gardens.
